intro: Eleiotis monophylla var. hebecarpa, commonly known as the broad-leafed eleiotis, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring large, broad leaves with a distinct veinal pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Its growth habit is primarily epiphytic, meaning it grows on the surfaces of trees without being parasitic. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
